snippet: The "Your Money" producer Nadia Taha shares her financial resolution for the coming year.
abstract: The "Your Money" producer Nadia Taha shares her financial resolution for the coming year.
lead_paragraph: I got married in 2010 to a law student. We entered the marriage with different financial circumstances: I'd been working for a few years, paying taxes, saving for retirement and building credit. He was in school, focused primarily on covering his tuition. So when we merged our finances, it made sense based on our differing positions (and my fascination with personal finance) that I would continue to manage the money for us both.

headline.main: Resolution: Resign as Family Chief Financial Officer
